A well-educated population would contribute to economic growth by increasing productivity, innovation, and job creation.
Free, high-quality education would promote social cohesion by fostering understanding, empathy, and cooperation among individuals from diverse cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds.
Access to education would empower individuals to make informed decisions about their lives, careers, and communities, leading to greater civic engagement and social responsibility.

A highly educated population would be better equipped to address complex global challenges, such as climate change, poverty, and inequality, by developing innovative solutions and collaborative approaches.

Free, high-quality education would also promote cultural diversity and understanding, as individuals from different parts of the world would have the opportunity to learn about and engage with one another's cultures.
